009package imagingbook.common.color;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015public abstract class RgbUtils {
016
017        public static int[] intToRgb(int p) {
018                int[] RGB = new int[3];
019                intToRgb(p, RGB);
020                return RGB;
021        }
022        
023        public static void intToRgb(int p, int[] RGB) {
024                RGB[0] = ((p >> 16) & 0xFF);
025                RGB[1] = ((p >> 8) & 0xFF);
026                RGB[2] = (p & 0xFF);
027        }
028
029        public static int rgbToInt(int red, int grn, int blu) {
030                return ((red & 0xff)<<16) | ((grn & 0xff)<<8) | blu & 0xff;
031        }
032
033        /**
034         * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
035         * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
036         * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
037         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
038         * @return the interpolated color
039         */
040        public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
041                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
042                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
043                }
044                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
045                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
046                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
047                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette.
052         * The interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color
053         * is returned, if 1 the last color.
054         * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
055         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
056         * @return the interpolated color
057         */
058        public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
059                if (palette.length < 2) {
060                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
061                }
062                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
063                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
064                }
065                final int n = palette.length;
066                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
067                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
068                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
069                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
070        }
071
072}
